title: Red Lily 2014 Fibonacci Vintner's Red (Rogue Valley)
description: Principally Touriga Nacional, along with 25% Tinta Cão and a bit of Tempranillo, this emphasizes the barrel flavors, somewhat disguising the subtle details of the fruit and site. If you're a fan of oaky reds, that won't bother you a bit.

title: Rigal 2015 Oltesse Malbec-Merlot (Cahors)
description: A lightly structured wine, this dwells more on the black fruits and good acidity. A core of tannins is surrounded by succulent fruitiness and a crisp aftertaste. Drink the wine from 2019.

title: Roger Roessler 2016 Black Pine Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Robust in earthy aromas, this wine is substantial on the palate, with big flavors of extracted raspberry that's nearly syrupy on the palate. Sizable tannin and oak play supporting roles.

title: Siegel 2017 Crucero Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)
description: This plump, above average Sauvignon Blanc has ripe, dusty melon aromas and bold green fruit and lettuce flavors. It finishes round and a bit flat, so drink immediately for maximum freshness.

title: Siltstone 2016 Blacktail Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: This wine's spicy pear aromas spring from the glass, and the flavors follow. There's a touch of lemon cookie and a bitter seed- and skin-inflected finish.

title: Steelhead Vineyards 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: This screw cap wine has a strong earthy scent at first whiff, but mellows into fresh herbs, grapefruit and white pepper after a little airing . It has great acidity, medium body and the refreshing qualities most people look for in a Sauvignon Blanc.

title: Telmo Rodríguez 2016 Al-muvedre Monastrell (Alicante)
description: There's some funk to this Monsatrell, starting with earthy, rubbery aromas that suggest animal fur, leather and volatility. Its full, bold palate delivers spicy, slightly roasted berry and plum flavors prior to a raw finish. It's more rustic than polished.

title: Tenuta Cavalier Pepe 2016 Refiano  (Fiano di Avellino)
description: This has delicate aromas of white spring flower and a whiff of white stone fruit. The fresh light-bodied palate offers Bartlett pear and a hint of lemon zest alongside bright acidity.

title: Uggiano 2015 Roccialta  (Chianti Classico)
description: This opens with aromas of violet and cooking spice. The straightforward palate offers clove, ripe black cherry and star anise alongside supple tannins. Drink soon.

title: Undurraga 2017 U Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)
description: Dry, citrusy aromas pop on the nose of this wine. It's more round in feel, with green fruit and herb flavors. Bell pepper and jalapeño notes show on the finish.

title: Van Zellers 2015 Red (Douro)
description: Produced by the Van Zeller family at Quinta Vale Dona Maria, this is a ripe wine with crisp red fruits, lively acidity and some fine, dusty tannins. The wine is meant to be drunk young, so go for it now.

title: Villa Dria 2015 Merlot-Cabernet (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: This wine is all stalky berry flavors and acidity. Light in texture, cool in character and floral, it ready to drink now.

title: Viña Bisquertt 2015 Ecos de Rulo Single Vineyard El Chequén Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)
description: This Cabernet feels a bit soft and sticky. Its rubbery, soupy berry aromas are more savory and earthy than bright and fruity. Oaky, herbal berry flavors dominate the palate, while the finish is punctuated by mildly choppy tannins.
designation: Ecos de Rulo Single Vineyard El Chequén Estate

title: Vinovalie 2015 Cuvée Tradition Malbec-Merlot (Cahors)
description: This soft, ripe wine offers the lightest of tannic touches, plenty of black fruits and balanced acidity. It is an easy wine, full of berry flavors with a ripe, generous aftertaste.

title: Vista Hills 2016 Willamette Valley Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This entry-level Pinot Noir from the Dundee Hills producer is simple and fresh, with juicy acidity. The fruit flavors recall cranberry and raspberry. Though still quite young, it's already soft from 10 months' aging in neutral oak.

title: 1848 Winery 2013 Fifth Generation Cabernet Franc (Judean Hills)
description: A fruit-forward nose of black cherry opens the palate for flavors of cherry, dark plum, smoked meat and eucalyptus. Cool herb flavors are a bit strong for some palates, and grippy tannins hold on tight into a mint-laced finish.

title: Adega Mãe 2016 Copo 3 Tinto Red (Lisboa)
description: This wine is balanced and full bodied. Its rich black fruits, a blend of Castelão and Aragonez, are full, with both ripeness and tannins. This generous wine is ready to drink.

title: Agate Ridge 2015 Petite Sirah (Southern Oregon)
description: This is a thick, peppery take on the variety, with potent tannins. It has a strong streak of vanilla running right through the center.

title: Agricola Alchemysta 2016 Parróne Grand Reserve Malbec (Cachapoal Valley)
description: Clammy, spicy wild berry aromas introduce this wine. Edgy acidity frames its dark fruit, prune and chocolate flavors. It finishes with wiry acidity that reverberates across the palate, thwarting harmony.

title: Alves de Sousa 2016 Bianco da Gaivosa White (Douro)
description: This is already a delicious, lightly spicy and perfumed wine to drink in the summer. Its freshness and acidity are balanced with warmer yellow and pineapple fruitiness. Drink now.

title: Amarano 2015 Cardenio  (Greco di Tufo)
description: The nose is quite shy but eventually reveals subtle whiffs suggesting orchard fruit and crushed rock. The medium-bodied palate is straightforward, offering peach and a saline note accompanied by fresh acidity.

title: Aresti 2015 Trisquel Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Curicó Valley)
description: This wine's earthy, nutty aromas seem slightly muddled. Its raw, saucy palate deals tomato-like acidity and firm tannins. Its dry, herbal flavors of tomato and red plum are a bit stewed and taste like clove on the finish.

title: Arnaud Baillot 2016  Bourgogne
description: This is a crisp, young wine with cherry flavors and still-tight acidity. With a soft texture and a juicy edge, it will develop quickly to give a perfumed, fruity wine.

title: Blue Fish 2016 Original Riesling (Pfalz)
description: Spry and juicy, this elegant dry Riesling offers ripe white-peach and apple flavors accented by a hint of orange blossom. Brisk acidity offsets a satiny finish. It's an approachable wine with wide appeal.

title: Buondonno 2015  Chianti Classico
description: This opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, cooking spice and a whiff of bay leaf. The no-frills palate suggests black cherry, sage and a hint of vanilla set against assertive tannins.

title: Cantine Olivella 2016 Bianco Caprettone (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)
description: Made with Caprettone, this opens with aromas of white flower, citrus and honey that carry over to the palate along with a bitter-almond note. It's lean but graceful, with vibrant acidity.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2016 Lab Reserva Red (Lisboa)
description: Named after a Labrador dog and nothing to do with people in white coats, this wine is earthy, fruity and ready to drink young for its jammy black fruit, acidity and delicious spice.

title: Cass 2017 Mr. Blanc White (Paso Robles Geneseo District)
description: Though light in the glass, this white blend shows extremely perfumed aromas of tuberose, passion fruit, tropical fruit soda and Juicy Fruit gum on the very ripe nose. Juicy flavors of mango, guava, papaya and Fruit Stripe gum show on the palate, which is clean yet a bit much.

title: Castaño 2016 Made With Organic Grapes Monastrell (Yecla)
description: Woody aromas combine with plum and berry scents in this organic Monsatrell. Roasted plum and berry flavors come with an oaky note of clove and sinewy tannins. It's bright, juicy and lively yet hot on the finish.

title: Castro de Pena Alba 2014 Picos de Couto Reserva Red (Dão)
description: This wine, a blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Alfrocheiro, is mildly tannic, certainly fruity and has an easy structure that will allow it to be drunk young. Black currants, red berries and acidity are all well balanced. Drink now.
